intro: Polyphlebium philippianum, commonly known as the Philippine moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Dicranaceae. It is characterized by its dense, carpet-like growth and is typically found in shaded, moist environments such as forests and rocky crevices. The plant has slender, wiry stems with leaf-like structures that are often curved or twisted. Its reproductive structures, including capsules, are borne on short, erect stalks. Polyphlebium philippianum plays an important ecological role in soil stabilization and moisture retention in its native habitats.
